name: African Wattled Lapwing
description: It has an overall gray-brown coloration. Distinctive features include bright yellow legs, yellow wattles on the head, and a red-and-white forehead. Males and females look alike.
food_note: Mainly various invertebrates, to a lesser extent seeds
image_alt: African wattled lapwing, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 23.5–25 cm; tail length 9–10.5 cm; wingspan 61–87 cm; weight 190–280 g
attractions: Like most lapwing species, it fearlessly defends its nesting territory, repelling predators with sharp dives and wing strikes.
breeding: The first African wattled lapwings were acquired from the wild in 2005. We have been breeding them since 2007.
